title: Site Reliability Engineer
summary: The Apple Information Apps Engineering teams power some of the most widely used Apple applications, such as Apple News, Stocks, Weather, and Books. We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) Operator to join our team in maintaining the reliability, availability, and performance of our systems.
description: Our team is highly collaborative, working closely with partner teams to deliver the best results for Apple. As an SRE at Apple, you will operate, monitor, and triage all aspects of our production and non-production environments, pioneer and implement the next generation telemetry system, prepare alert handling procedures, automate deployment and orchestration of services, actively participate in capacity planning and disaster recovery exercises, interact with and support partner teams, and cultivate relationships with internal and external vendors.
key_qualifications: At least 3 years of prior demonstrated experience in a Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or an Infrastructure-focused role. Linux expertise. Support of internet-facing production services and distributed systems. Proficiency in monitoring and observability tools. Hands-on experience with Kubernetes. Strong sense of ownership and team comradery.
education_experience: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or other related discipline.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay for this role ranges between $135,400 and $250,600. Additionally, employees have the opportunity to become shareholders, receive benefits such as medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, discounted products and services, educational expense reimbursement, and may be eligible for bonuses, commission payments, and relocation.
